mainBoard.flavorText: The most terrifying thing about the Craw Wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.
mainBoard.name: Craw Wurm

mainBoard.flavorText: "And the unclean spirits went out, and entered the swine; and the herd ran violently . . ." —Mark 5:13

mainBoard.flavorText: While it possesses potent venom, the Giant Spider often chooses not to paralyze its victims. Perhaps the creature enjoys the gentle rocking motion caused by its captives' struggles to escape its web.
mainBoard.name: Giant Spider
mainBoard.originalText: Does not fly, but can block flying creatures.

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

mainBoard.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

mainBoard.flavorText: Don't try to outrun one of Dominia's Grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.
mainBoard.name: Grizzly Bears

foreignData.name: Energieschub

Die verzauberte Kreatur kann bereits in der Runde, in der sie beschworen wurde, angreifen.
0: Enttappe die durch Energieschub verzauberte Kreatur während Deines Zuges. Du kannst diese Eigenschaft aber nur einmal pro Zug anwenden.

mainBoard.name: Instill Energy
mainBoard.originalText: You may untap target creature one additional time during your turn. Target creature may also attack the turn it comes into play.

rulings.text: If attached to an opponent's creature, you can untap their creature during your turn.
Instill Energy's untap ability will not untap the creature until it resolves. This means other spells and abilities can be used before it actually becomes untapped.

Any Auras (or other effects) which are on the creature that would cause it to not be untapped (or have a cost to be untapped) during untap step do not in any way hinder or imply a cost to use this card's ability to untap once during the turn.

mainBoard.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can attack as though it had haste.
{0}: Untap enchanted creature. Activate only during your turn and only once each turn.

mainBoard.flavorText: The mating habits of Treefolk, particularly the stalwart Ironroot Treefolk, are truly absurd. Molasses comes to mind. It's amazing the species can survive at all given such protracted periods of mate selection, conjugation, and gestation.
mainBoard.name: Ironroot Treefolk

mainBoard.flavorText: The communal mind produces a savage strategy, yet no one could predict that this vicious crossbreed would unravel the secret of steel.
mainBoard.name: Killer Bees

mainBoard.name: Ley Druid
mainBoard.originalText: ocT: Untap a land of your choice. This ability is played as an interrupt.

rulings.text: The land is untapped as a normal ability that goes on the stack. It is not a mana ability, so it can’t be used at times that only mana abilities can be used.

mainBoard.name: Mishra's Factory
mainBoard.originalText:
Tap to add 1 colorless mana to your mana pool or give any Assembly Worker +1/+1 until end of turn.
{1}: Mishra's Factory becomes an Assembly Worker, a 2/2 artifact creature, until end of turn. Assembly Worker is still considered a land as well.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that becomes a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature. Notably, if you turn Mishra's Factory into a creature on the turn it entered the battlefield, you won't be able to then activate its first or last abilities.
After it becomes a creature, Mishra's Factory will still have all its abilities.

mainBoard.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{1}: This land becomes a 2/2 Assembly-Worker artifact creature until end of turn. It's still a land.
{T}: Target Assembly-Worker creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

mainBoard.name: Nafs Asp
mainBoard.originalText: If Asp inflicts any damage on your opponent, your opponent must spend {1} before the draw phase of his or her next turn or lose an additional 1 life.

rulings.text: If it damages a player twice, they get to pay or take damage twice during their next draw step.
If its damage gets redirected to its controller, it will still trigger the ability.
The ability does not cause itself to trigger again. It cause loss of life, and not damage.
The player can pay the {1} mana at any time after damage is done before the draw step of that player’s turn. People commonly pay during upkeep.

mainBoard.text: Whenever this creature deals damage to a player, that player loses 1 life at the beginning of their next draw step unless they pay {1} before that draw step.

mainBoard.name: Oasis
mainBoard.originalText: Tap to prevent 1 damage to any creature.
mainBoard.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.

mainBoard.flavorText: Everybody knows that to ward off trouble, you knock on wood. But usually it's better to make a wall out of the wood and let trouble do the knocking.
mainBoard.name: Wall of Wood

sideBoard.flavorText: Moving without sound, swift figures pass through branches and undergrowth completely unhindered. One with the trees around them, the Dryads of Shanodin Forest are seen only when they wish to be.
sideBoard.name: Shanodin Dryads
